page.title: 05 DUNTRUNE
page.content: At Burnside of Duntrune there is a bridge over the Fithie Burn.Before the bridge there is a weir and a resevoir which was used to feed the water through to the old mill.The mill began life as a flax mill,then it became a wheat mill and finally it was a saw mill.The mill is now in ruins.On the resevoir behind the weir there are geese.Sometimes the geese lose their eggs because the nest is too low in the water and the eggs are too cold to hatch.The geese return every year perhaps because the man who lives in the old school house beside the bridge feeds them every day.
